channel.title: SpellCaster
channel.description:
Oook.
So, I decided to make my own SCAR script because my fingers were getting tired from having to cast Curse over and over again on my Spellpuppet.
But, I have very little [almost no] knowledge about coding in SCAR.
I know what I need to do, just not the commands or how to use them :P
Here's what I have so far: [code]{KyleGut3's Very First Script!! Wheeeeee! Be Sure To Enjoy :D}
program SpellCaster005;
const SpellColor=000000; PuppetColor=000000;
begin repeat
until(out of runes)
end.[/code]
What I wanted was for SCAR to find the co-ordinates of two points, the spell that I want casted, and where the puppet is trapped. From there I wanted the script to move my mouse to the spell, click, and then move to the puppet, right click, and cast.
I've tried reading all the tutorials here, but I found myself more confused than when I started and with more of a headache.
If you guys could help me that would be awesome! Please and Thank You! [With a cherry, if you so like]
-KyleGut3

item.title: SpellCaster
item.dc:creator: @Arkanor Arkanor
item.description:
@Arkanor wrote:

You would never be hiding behidn a tree to begin with. And good scripters don’t do stuff like

if(findcolor(blah blah))then clickmouse(x,y,true);

They use IsTextAt or other versions (preferably the ones in SRL) to detect the presence of objects/spells.

Read full topic

item.title: SpellCaster
item.dc:creator: @iruleatants iruleatants
item.description:
@iruleatants wrote:

findcolor will lag if it cant find the puppet. so that why i dont like it, findcolor is always effective, you have to find a color that isnt anywhere else in the script.

what if your hiding behind a tree maging a level 100 beast and your 25, then it clicks on a color other than the puppets and you die… i dont like color finding that way(besides if i new speel comes then ill just rewrite cords, takes 2 secs and has no errors)

so there are cases where you have to use findcolor, but it still gay…

[off topic]
happy birthday kyle
[/off topic :D]

Read full topic

item.title: SpellCaster
item.dc:creator: @Arkanor Arkanor
item.description:
@Arkanor wrote:

[quote=“iruleatants, post:19, topic:1343”]why would you use find color, noob

the speel never changes its location on ly the puppet(wich is why u need to use findcolor)

using findcolor isnt always the best, it will only go to the fist color it see, also, colors are dynamic,

so u always use clickmouse first, then if it wont work findcolor[/quote]

You just called Surajd a noob. Oh wow, man. Just wow.

You hate findcolor probably because you don’t understand how to use it. Clickmouse is good for limited endeavors (and of course it’s necessary for newb scripters who don’t use includes), but to just rely on coords is st00pid. You can narrow the search box for the color to the general region of the spell box area, and so if Fagex ever moves the location of the spell by adding a new spell, your script won’t be broken.

Read full topic

item.title: SpellCaster
item.dc:creator: @ShadowSyntax ShadowSyntax
item.description:
@ShadowSyntax wrote:

Iruleants’ script will work, although it isn’t too undetectable.
One of the easiest things you can do to make a script undetectable is to make where it clicks random using the random() function.

e.g.
movemousesmooth(740+random(3),188+random(3));

This would randomly pick one of however many numbers.
random(3) would pick one of three numbers (including zero)
so: 0,1,2

So in theory the command could move the mouse to:
740,188
742,189
741,190
740,189
etc.

To break down the commands more:
movemousesmooth(x,y); - Moves the mouse smoothly across the screen (without jumping around) to the co-ordinates x and y
clickmouse(x,y,true); - Clicks the mouse at x and y. To make the script less detectable move the mouse using movemousesmooth to where you want it to click before using this command. To make it even more detectible use an include (dont worry about that for now)
wait(k); - pauses the script for k amount of miliseconds (replace k with however many miliseconds you want the script to pause for). 1000 miliseconds = 1 second.
getcolor(x,y)=1773070 - finds what the colour is at the co-ordinates x and y and checks if the colour is 1773070.

The finding colour thing:
if findcolor(x,y,ppc,17,16,494,319)
The 4 numbers show the script which area of the screen to search in (I’m going to assume you already know how to find co-ordinates).
For example, to make it search for that colour in the inventory screen you would move your mouse over the top left corner of your inventory and get the x and y co-ordinates.
Then you would make the first two numbers of the command whatever the x and y co-ordinates you chose were (respectively).
Now move your mouse to the bottom right hand corner of your inventory and pick the co-ordinates. Replace the last two values of the findcolor command with the new x and y co-ordinates.

Read full topic

item.title: SpellCaster
item.dc:creator: @KyleGut3 KyleGut3
item.description:
@KyleGut3 wrote:

If you tell me(or us) what the script is for then maybe we can help more

Alright then, basically this script that im trying to make is for the singular purpose of increasing your magic. It should, in theory, click on the spell of your choice, and then cast it at your ‘SpellPuppet’ [a trapped npc in RS that preferably cannot attack back [unlike lesser demon]].

It should also shut off as soon as you no longer have enough runes to cast the spell.

Is that more specific?

EDIT:
@iru
The script you wrote worked pretty well, though I had to add a few wait to make sure it clicked on the right spell, etc. And so it didn;t move ub3r fast.

Also : Is there any way to make the movements of the mouse more humanlike? It was still pretty spastic.

Read full topic
